title: Recreate uploaded mobile UI with multiple form layout variations

requirements.text: Recreate the mobile app UI shown in the uploaded prototype images as a responsive web UI, matching the overall layout and components: green top app bar, light content area, rounded cards, and a bottom navigation with tabs for Home and History.

quotes: Make same as this ui and give in different forms

acceptanceCriteria: UI includes a green header/app bar area similar to the screenshots (title aligned left or centered depending on screen).
UI includes a bottom navigation bar with Home and History tabs and clear active state styling.
Layouts look mobile-first and remain usable on desktop (centered phone-width container or responsive max width).

requirements.text: Implement the four primary screens depicted in the images with matching structure and English UI text: (1) Home/Welcome with 'Food Wastage Solution', welcome message, 'Add Food' CTA, and a 'Nearby NGOs' map preview card; (2) Add Food screen with image preview and fields for Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and a 'Post' button; (3) NGO Alert screen with alert text, map/route preview, and a 'Track' button; (4) History screen listing posted items with date/time and quantity, plus bottom navigation.

quotes: Make same as this ui and give in different forms

acceptanceCriteria: Home screen shows: header 'Food Wastage Solution', 'Welcome, user!' and an 'Add Food' button, plus a 'Nearby NGOs' section with a map preview card.
Add Food screen shows: header 'Add Food', an image area, labeled inputs for Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and a prominent 'Post' button.
NGO Alert screen shows: header 'NGO Alert', a bold alert headline (e.g., 'Food donation received'), a short message, a map/route preview, and a 'Track' button.
History screen shows: header 'History' and a vertical list of items (e.g., Leftover pasta/Salad/Rice) with date/time and quantity aligned similarly to the screenshot.
Navigating via bottom tabs switches between Home and History; Home provides a way to reach Add Food; Add Food can navigate to NGO Alert after posting (UI flow can be simulated).

requirements.text: Provide the 'Add Food' functionality UI in multiple different form variations (different forms/layouts) while keeping the same fields and actions, and allow the user to switch between them in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 distinct Add Food form variations are available (e.g., single-page card form, multi-step wizard, and modal/drawer form), each containing Title, Quantity, Date, Time, and Submit/Post action.
A clear control (tabs/segmented control/dropdown) lets users switch between the form variations on the Add Food page.
All variations validate required fields at least minimally (e.g., empty Title/Quantity prevents submit and shows an inline error).

requirements.text: Implement a lightweight demo data model in the UI so that posting a food item adds it to History, and the NGO Alert screen can display a sample alert for the most recent post (no real maps/GPS required).
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting any Add Food variation adds an item to the History list (with title, date/time, quantity).
After posting, the app can show an NGO Alert screen for the most recent post (static demo message is acceptable).
No external map services are used; map sections are placeholders that still match the prototype layout.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, eco-focused visual theme consistent with the prototype: green primary color, neutral background, simple typography, and subtle shadows/rounded corners; keep the style consistent across all screens (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).
acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI color is green and consistently applied to headers and primary buttons.
Cards, lists, and inputs use consistent spacing, border radius, and shadow across pages.
Typography hierarchy is consistent (screen title > section title > body text).

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI where the prototype shows an image preview and map placeholders.
acceptanceCriteria: All images listed in imageRequirements.required exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Add Food uses the provided food placeholder image in the image preview area.
Home and NGO Alert screens use the provided map placeholder images in their map preview areas.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other frontend immutable paths; compose them from app code instead.
Do not use external map/GPS/location services; map areas must be placeholders.
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
nonGoals: Implementing real NGO discovery based on geolocation.
Integrating third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
Real-time tracking, WebSockets, or push notifications.
Pixel-perfect recreation of device frames shown in the photos; only the app UI inside the frames must be recreated.

required: Minimal map placeholder card background with faint streets and two red location pins (map-placeholder-home.dim_900x600.png)
Minimal map placeholder with a curved route line between two pins (map-placeholder-route.dim_900x600.png)
Food bowl/plate photo-style placeholder on neutral background (food-placeholder.dim_900x600.png)
Simple eco/leaf app logo icon, flat style, green tones (app-logo.dim_512x512.png)
